subject: Travel
title: Japan's Cherry Blossom Parks
description: A short lesson to help you apply Japan's Cherry Blossom Parks.

hook.text: Every spring, Japan tracks cherry blossoms like weather. A 'sakura front' moves north across the country.

buildup.text: Hanami â€” flower viewing â€” has been a tradition for over 1,000 years. Families picnic under the trees.

discovery.text: The blossoms last only one to two weeks. Their brief beauty symbolizes the fleeting nature of life.

twist.text: Climate change is making them bloom earlier. Kyoto's cherry blossoms now peak 11 days earlier than in 1950.

climax.text: Scientists use 1,200 years of bloom records kept by monks to track the acceleration of climate change.

punchline.text: Cherry blossoms are beautiful, brief, and now a climate alarm.

quiz.question: What do cherry blossoms symbolize in Japanese culture?
